[{"id":"efdbc612-7a76-431a-9980-0f714bf8770f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"309c13d9-3c92-40c9-b074-6bed747aa27d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class represents a single class definition within the Jarvis analysis model. Its primary responsibility is to maintain the class's identity and its ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Method Resolution Order (MRO)","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In Python, understanding inheritance is crucial for determining which method is actually executed when a call is made on an object; this class provides the logic to build and manage that lookup hierarchy.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"10b7fb34-ef6b-4a7b-b587-589d322677fa","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"109607f9-8ea5-43c2-bb67-0473702d9914","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3ebf66cf-81ad-489e-8b1c-99cab018b4f0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"str","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The fully qualified namespace of the class (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"app.models.BaseUser","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ee7d10a7-6b96-45e0-ac77-b37a06b161c1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"str","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The name of the module where this class is physically defined.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7ae4d0e8-83de-4b92-b9ff-23c702c63130","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"mro","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"list","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): An ordered list of namespaces representing the inheritance chain, starting with the class itself.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ff49afc1-73a6-46b3-9d49-0f467c91047f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"898b3f8a-46ae-4283-993d-3c80d7a9b0f3","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7386077f-ae66-4a9e-ba43-23608a6aa155","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__(ns, module)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes the class node. It automatically sets the first entry of the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"mro","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the class's own namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0b43c93a-eccb-4a67-bb99-95ae5d8edec3","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_parent(parent)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Adds inheritance targets to the class. It accepts either a single string (one parent) or a list of strings (multiple inheritance). After adding parents, it calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"fix_mro","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ensure internal consistency.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d9120481-f468-4d6a-9911-e6552db8a062","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"fix_mro()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"An internal cleanup utility. It iterates through the current MRO and removes duplicate entries, keeping only the most specific occurrences (the ones appearing later in the list) to maintain correct Python resolution semantics.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dc812fc1-f55b-4ffe-a63b-f65a57bbdb53","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_mro()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Returns the current resolution list. This is used by the analyzer to find methods or attributes that might be inherited from parent classes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"26957b92-df46-444d-8b3d-14d0671967b2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_module()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves the name of the module containing this class definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8fbd7122-8ece-4de8-aba5-2c7cadebf1e2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"compute_mro()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Finalizes the resolution order. It ensures that the MRO is ordered correctly from the most specific class (itself) to the most general (base classes), with all duplicates removed.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bb321a2a-c029-482a-b163-bb1a801471e2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"clear_mro()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Resets the inheritance list, leaving only the class's own namespace. This is used when the analyzer needs to re-evaluate inheritance, perhaps due to a dynamic update in the project structure.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f8649967-0b81-4519-bb59-f78d33f43bae","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"48d89051-5250-43c0-8d31-2d0479968504","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0e984c1c-c32d-4743-9b5f-b040dfc943ff","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is used to resolve where a method like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"save()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" comes from when analyzing ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User.save()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"09c23745-92e9-4c6b-89dc-c7222fe98849","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from classes import ClassNode

# 1. Define a class 'Admin' in the 'auth' module
admin_node = ClassNode("auth.Admin", "auth")

# 2. Add inheritance: Admin inherits from User and Base
# This simulates: class Admin(User, Base):
admin_node.add_parent(["auth.User", "core.Base"])

# 3. Finalize the resolution order
admin_node.compute_mro()

# 4. Inspect the resolution chain
hierarchy = admin_node.get_mro()
print(f"Resolution order for Admin: {hierarchy}")
# Output: ['auth.Admin', 'auth.User', 'core.Base']

# 5. Use the MRO to find a method
# The analyzer would check auth.Admin, then auth.User, then core.Base","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"90e14e6b-aac6-46ff-9634-4f4bedbad865","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fc373103-d99c-4dc1-a97a-986821b51cf5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inheritance Resolution","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By maintaining the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"mro","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" list, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows Jarvis to perform ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"class-aware analysis","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". If a method isn't defined in the current class, the analyzer uses the MRO to find the correct parent implementation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7c74e43b-96c1-495a-8768-5d3f62196afb","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Deduplication","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"fix_mro","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"compute_mro","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" methods prevent "circular" or redundant inheritance paths from breaking the analysis, mirroring how the Python interpreter handles complex multiple inheritance.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c53fc273-cf0f-4e3a-bd9e-f6519ac59839","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace-Based","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Because it uses strings (namespaces) rather than direct object references for parents, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can model inheritance even before the parent classes have been fully parsed or analyzed.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"34a40503-8f52-4c05-9df8-a364f3041f02","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
